title: Things to do in London this weekend
text: London weekend weather forecast Hot weather looks set to linger in London following Wednesday's heatwave. This London weather forecast is generated by the Met Office Weather Widget Here are a few events to help you make the most of your weekend. Wimbledon Needing no introduction, Wimbledon continues until July 12. Unfortunately, those who haven’t already secured tickets are unlikely to be able to see the action up close: advance tickets have, of course, sold out, and organisers warn that those who queue for on-the-day ticket sales will likely wait for hours. There are, however, a number of venues throughout the city that are screening matches, often for free. For more details, see our complete guide to the best places to watch Wimbledon in London . When: until Sunday July 12 Where: citywide • The best hotels in central London Hampton Court Palace Flower Show Now in its 25th year, the Hampton Court Palace Flower Show is putting on quite a spectacle to ensure an expected 130,000 or so spectators are suitably wowed on the silver anniversary of the world’s largest annual flower show. Incredible floral displays will be found throughout the grounds - the rose marquee expected to be particularly popular - and various experts will be on hand to guide aspiring gardeners in their efforts to create their own green havens at home. When: until Sunday July 4 Where: Hampton Court Palace, Surrey, KT8 9AU Getting there: by rail to Hampton Court Cost: from £19.50 Don't forget to check out the awesome #floralinnovation exhibits at #RHSHampton - floral creativity at its finest! pic.twitter.com/woir8Y06O2 — The RHS (@The_RHS) July 1, 2015 Summer Streets on Regent Street This Sunday (and on the following three Sundays in July), Regent Street will be transformed into a pedestrian plaza replete with all manner of themed activities as part of the Summer Streets series. Kicking things off with a garden theme this weekend, the street will feature summer lawns with deckchairs, a sustainable bee and butterfly zone, and various pop-up outlets and diversions. Subsequent weekends will focus on health and fitness, fashion and arts, and culture. When: Sunday July 5 Getting there: by Tube to Oxford Circus or Piccadilly Circus Cost: free Brown’s London Art Weekend; Mayfair If you’ve been hesitant to explore the high-end galleries that dot Mayfair, now’s your chance. During Brown’s London Art Weekend , some 100 gallery spaces in the district will be inviting one and all to admire their exhibitions and participate in special events. Brown’s hotel , meanwhile, serves as the festival’s hub and will host a number of special talks (“Fashion in Art” and “How to start your art collection”, for example) and other complementary events. When: Friday July 3 to Sunday July 5 Where: throughout Mayfair Getting there: by Tube to Green Park or Bond Street Cost: prices vary; exhibitions are typically free, the talks cost £30 • The best hotels in central London See the Serpentine Pavilion; Kensington Galleries The annual unveiling of the Serpentine’s temporary pavilion is another welcome sign that the London summer season is fully up and running. This time Spanish architects José Selgas and Lucía Cano are the team behind the design - an effervescent, candy-coloured tunnel - that drew inspiration from an unlikely source: the London Underground. Speaking to the Telegraph about their intentions, the designers said: “We like the way the Underground brings everyone together…We wanted to bring that feeling here, so we’ve created a very open space with lots of entry points and it’s up to you to find your corner.” You can learn more about their intentions, and see the pavilion for yourself, in our video . When: from Thursday June 25 to Sunday October 18 Where: Serpentine Gallery, Kensington Galleries, W2 3XA Getting there: by Tube to Knightsbridge Cost: free Here are a few pictures from the inside of the new @SerpentineUK Pavilion by #selgascano . More dazzling colours! pic.twitter.com/uIncLjukGl — Yannick Pucci (@ypldn) June 29, 2015 • The best hotels in central London Follow @telegraphtravel
